trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Vandalia
There were no other sightings in Vandalia on or around September 11th 2007
Summary: Passed @ high alt. slowly S.E . to N. N.W. silent no vapor trail.
divs: Sighting DetailsOur apt. is on the second floor with the living room window facing due north. I am constantly looking out at aircraft and the sky as a matter of habit as I am a flying buff and student pilot. There is nothing but open field between my residense and the Dayton Int'l. Airport which makes aircraft viewing a daily delight. The sky was virtually cloudless as a cold front had moved through earlier this morning.The sun was still up and giving off a bright reflection which caught my attention.The craft had already passed over the apartment coming from the South East when I first noticed it. As I looked at it I was checking for wings , tail, power plant and or vapor trail but was unable to detect any. I began trying to determine size and altitude. I would have to say it had to be twice as large as a 747 body and an estimated altitude of 15 to 20 thousand feet. Its airspeed was compareable to that of a Piper Cub. After assuring myself I wasn't watching just another aircraft flying over I called in my 10 year old son to ask him "whats that look like to you?" He caught sight of what I was looking at and after a moment or two he just simply said "a UFO". We watched it for a couple more minutes as it progressed on off to the North West with light being reflected off of it all the while.Eventually it was at too great of a distance to see it any longer.The entire sighting lasted about 4-5 minutes. Whether it was one of ours or "theirs" it WAS without a doubt. This by the way is not my first sighting by any means. Jeff Lyons
